Class JPSPathfinder

java.lang.Object
com.orasaari.Pathfinder
com.orasaari.JPSPathfinder
class JPSPathfinder extends Pathfinder
Implementation of the JPS algorith. For the decription of the algorigthm, see the original paper:

  • Method Details

    • pruneNeighbours

      private List<Integer> pruneNeighbours(Node node)
      "neighbours(x) ← prune(x, neighbours(x))" Identify the neighbours of the node that need to be handled by pruning. To minimize overhead, we only identify directions to evaluate further and create actual node objects later as needed. Enforcing stric cornering rules makes diagonal movement simpler: we don't have to check the nodes 90 degrees towards our movement directions since they are not possible successors anymore. The vertical movement code is split to more cases than would be technically necessary to keep the code more readable and understandable.
      Parameters:
      movingDirection - Direction from which the node was arrvived from, value mapping to MapUtil.MOVES.
      currentNode - The node whose neighbours are evaluated.
      Returns:
      successors List of prunded neighbours that needs to be evaluated to extend the path.

    • identifySuccessors

      private void identifySuccessors(Node currentNode, int goalX, int goalY)
      "Algorithm 1 Identify Successors Require: x: current node, s: start, g: goal" Implement the part of the algorithm that is labelled as "Identify Successors" in the original paper.

    • jump

      private Node jump(Node currentNode, int arrivalDirection, int goalX, int goalY)
      "Algorithm 2 Function jump Require: x: initial node, ~d: direction, s: start, g: goal" Implement the most critical part of JPS: the jump function. The recursive function searches the next jump point according to the rules described in the original paper.

    • findPath

      public PathfindingResult findPath(GridMap map, int startX, int startY, int goalX, int goalY)
      Implement the JPS pathfinding.
      Specified by:
      findPath in class Pathfinder
      Parameters:
      map - The used for pathfinding
      startX - X coordinate of the start point
      startY - Y coodrinate of the start point
      goalX - X coordinate of the goal
      goalY - Y coordinate of the goal
      Returns:
      the Result object wrapping the pathfinding results
